definitions.definition: One which receives or entertains a guest, socially, commercially, or officially.
definitions.example: A good host is always considerate of the guest’s needs.

definitions.definition: One that provides a facility for an event.
A person or organization responsible for running an event.
definitions.example: Our company is host of the annual conference this year.

definitions.definition: A moderator or master of ceremonies for a performance.
definitions.example: The host was terrible, but the acts themselves were good.

definitions.definition: Any computer attached to a network.
A cell or organism which harbors another organism or biological entity, usually a parasite.
definitions.example: Viruses depend on the host that they infect in order to be able to reproduce.

definitions.definition: (evolution) An organism bearing certain genetic material.
definitions.example: The so-called junk DNA is known, so far, to provide no apparent benefit to its host.

definitions.definition: A paid male companion offering conversation and in some cases sex, as in certain types of bar in Japan.
To perform the role of a host.
definitions.example: I was terrible at hosting that show.

definitions.definition: To run software made available to a remote user or process.
definitions.example: Kremvax hosts a variety of services.

definitions.definition: A multitude of people arrayed as an army; used also in religious senses, as: Heavenly host (of angels)
A large number of items; a large inventory.
definitions.example: The dealer stocks a host of parts for my Model A.

definitions.definition: The consecrated bread or wafer of the Eucharist.
